results.title: Choosing for happiness
results.creator_credit: Irving Jacoby, McGraw-Hill Films and Willard Van Dyke
results.brief_description: Based on the texts by Henry A. Bowman, this instructional piece, for young women, is about choosing the right lifemate. The film focuses on Eve, a college student, attractive and full of life but mysteriously single. Flash-backs follow and show why. Eve’s failure, according to this film is due to the fact that her choices never match up to her criteria: “Is he right for me?” But with the help of her friend Mary, she learns that: “You can’t make over a man like you do a room.” But she still ends up without a boyfriend. Unintentionally hilarious.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Irving Jacoby, McGraw-Hill Films and Willard Van Dyke

results.title: Choosing a theme and matching a style: 'The Gallery'
results.creator_credit: Gil Brealey, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Philip Law

results.title: Choosing a leader
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Balla, Julia Murphy and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “What Do You Think”.
An open-ended discussion film for teenaged groups dealing with the problem of choosing a leader. The story concerns a group of boys and girls hiking in the woods, facing the possibility of being lost. One boy, always highly admired because of his athletic prowess, wants to take one direction; another boy, with considerable logic on his side, wants to take the other. What are the factors the group must take into consideration in deciding whose leadership to choose? The question is left with the film audience.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Nicholas Balla, Julia Murphy and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Choosing a dog
results.creator_credit: Frank Gardner and Central Office of Information
results.brief_description: A film survey of British bred dogs. The salient physical and mental characteristics of different breeds are examined and appealing portraits of canine favourites appear on the screen. A more serious activity of these animals - their invaluable services as guide dogs to the blind - is also illustrated.

results.title: Choosing
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Job Catch”.
This is part of a series designed for use by upper secondary school students and school leavers. This program shows students how to determine an appropriate career path based on their personal and creative attributes and interests. It outlines a four stage process for subject choice - self description, creating a direction, active investigation and taking action.

results.title: Choose with care
results.brief_description: This is an information and training program designed to assist organisations establish a safe environment for the children and young people in their care such as child care centres, youth groups, sports clubs, before and after school care programs and all other organisations working with children and young people. It provides a proactive, preventative and participatory approach to building and maintaining child safe organisations. A comprehensive handbook is also included in this package.

results.title: Cholesterol: eat your heart out
results.brief_description: Set in Toronto, this film follows an experiment designed to determine the effect of diet on the blood cholesterol level of high school students. Points out benefits of reducing cholesterol in the diet. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: Cholesterol
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Quantum”.
Heart disease is the biggest cause of death in Australia, causing 30,000 deaths per year. Although heart disease has many causes one of those most publicised is high cholesterol levels. But is cholesterol really the major villain, and is it easily combated by dietary changes? This program looks at cholesterol in detail, noting that there is “good” cholesterol and “bad” cholesterol and that the effects of cholesterol on the individual may be due more to factors such as sex and genetic makeup than diet.

results.title: Choking: to save a life. - Revised edition.
results.brief_description: Describes the lifesaving procedures for clearing the airway of a choking person. Examines causes and symptons of choking and emphasizes the necessity for rapid reaction time in treating the choking victim.

results.brief_description: Covers first aid for choking in a variety of situations, using practical demonstrations and animation to explain procedures. Also covers aspects of self-help and first aid for pregnant women who are choking.
